title: Closed walks on a vertex of a fixed length as words

blocks.name: cclwwlknon
blocks.content: Extend class notation with closed walks (in an undirected graph) anchored at a fixed vertex and of a fixed length as word over the set of vertices.
blocks.origin: const class cclwwlknon { ClWWalksNOn }

blocks.name: diff.cclwwlknon.s
diff.cclwwlknon.c
diff.cclwwlknon.w
df-clwwlknon
blocks.content: Define the set of all closed walks a graph ` g ` , anchored at a fixed vertex ` v ` (i.e., a walk starting and ending at the fixed vertex ` v ` , also called "a closed walk on vertex ` v ` ") and having a fixed length ` n ` as words over the set of vertices. Such a word corresponds to the sequence v=p(0) p(1) ... p(n-1) of the vertices in a closed walk p(0) e(f(1)) p(1) e(f(2)) ... p(n-1) e(f(n)) p(n)=p(0)=v as defined in ~ df-clwlks . The set ` ( ( v ( ClWWalksNOn `` g ) n ) ` corresponds to the set of "walks from v to v of length n" in a statement of [Huneke] p. 2. (Contributed by AV, 24-Feb-2022.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-clwwlknon(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  |- wceq(cclwwlknon, cmpt(s0, universe, cmpo(s1, s2, cfv(cvtx, cv(s0)), cn0, crab(s3, co(cv(s2), cclwwlkn, cv(s0)), wceq(cfv(cv(s3), nat0), cv(s1))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-clwwlknon(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  ‚ä¢ ClWWalksNOn =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶(s1 ‚àà(Vtx ` s0), s2 ‚àà ‚Ñï0 ‚Ü¶ { s3 ‚àà(s2[ClWWalksN]s0)|(s3 ` 0)= s1 }))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
}

blocks.name: clwwlknonmpt2
blocks.content: ` ( ClWWalksNOn `` G ) ` is an operator mapping a vertex ` v ` and a nonnegative integer ` n ` to the set of closed walks on ` v ` of length ` n ` as words over the set of vertices in a graph ` G ` . (Contributed by AV, 25-Feb-2022.)

thm clwwlknon(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0[(ClWWalksNOn ` c1)]c2)= { s0 ‚àà(c2[ClWWalksN]c1)|(s0 ` 0)= c0 }
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c2)
} = {
  pm2.61i((c0[(ClWWalksNOn ` c1)]c2)= { s0 ‚àà(c2[ClWWalksN]c1)|(s0 ` 0)= c0 }, (c0 ‚àà(Vtx ` c1)‚àß c2 ‚àà ‚Ñï0))
  ovmpt2(hs0, hs1, c0, (Vtx ` c1), c2, cn0, (ClWWalksNOn ` c1), { s0 ‚àà(c2[ClWWalksN]c1)|(s0 ` 0)= c0 }, { s0 ‚àà(hs1[ClWWalksN]c1)|(s0 ` 0)= hs0 }, { s0 ‚àà(hs1[ClWWalksN]c1)|(s0 ` 0)= c0 })
  rabbidv(s0, (hs1[ClWWalksN]c1), hs0 = c0, (s0 ` 0)= hs0, (s0 ` 0)= c0)
  eqeq2(hs0, c0, (s0 ` 0))
  rabeqdv(s0, (hs1[ClWWalksN]c1), (c2[ClWWalksN]c1), hs1 = c2, (s0 ` 0)= c0)
  oveq1(hs1, c2, cclwwlkn, c1)
  rabex(s0, (c2[ClWWalksN]c1), (s0 ` 0)= c0)
  ovex(c2, cclwwlkn, c1)
  eqtr4d((c0[(ClWWalksNOn ` c1)]c2), { s0 ‚àà(c2[ClWWalksN]c1)|(s0 ` 0)= c0 }, emptycls, ¬¨(c0 ‚àà(Vtx ` c1)‚àß c2 ‚àà ‚Ñï0))

  sylbi(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(co(c3, cclwwlkn, c2), cfn), wcel(cfv(cvtx, c2), cfn))

This theorem would not hold for ` N = 0 ` if ` W = X = (/) ` . (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 20-Sep-2018.) (Revised by AV, 28-May-2021.) (Revised by AV, 24-Mar-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm clwwlknonel(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {

blocks.name: clwwlknonccat
blocks.content: The concatenation of two words representing closed walks on a vertex ` X ` represents a closed walk on vertex ` X ` . The resulting walk is a "double loop", starting at vertex ` X ` , coming back to ` X ` by the first walk, following the second walk and finally coming back to ` X ` again. (Contributed by AV, 24-Apr-2022.)

blocks.name: clwwlknon1loop
blocks.content: If there is a loop at vertex ` X ` , the set of (closed) walks on ` X ` of length ` 1 ` as words over the set of vertices is a singleton containing the singleton word consisting of ` X ` . (Contributed by AV, 11-Feb-2022.) (Revised by AV, 25-Feb-2022.) (Proof shortened by AV, 25-Mar-2022.)

  jca(wa(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(csn(c0), c2)), wceq(cv(hs0), cs1(c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), cword(c1)), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), cs1(c0)), wcel(csn(c0), c2)))

blocks.name: clwwlknon2num
blocks.content: In a ` K `-regular graph ` G ` , there are ` K ` closed walks on vertex ` X ` of length ` 2 ` . (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 19-Sep-2018.) (Revised by AV, 28-May-2021.) (Revised by AV, 25-Feb-2022.) (Proof shortened by AV, 25-Mar-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm clwwlknon2num(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wbr(c0, crusgr, c1), wcel(c2, cfv(cvtx, c0))), wceq(cfv(chash, co(c2, cfv(cclwwlknon, c0), nat2)), c1))
} = {
  eqtrd(cfv(chash, co(c2, cfv(cclwwlknon, c0), nat2)), c1, cfv(chash, crab(hs0, cword(cfv(cvtx, c0)), w3a(wceq(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), nat2), wcel(cpr(cfv(cv(hs0), nat0), cfv(cv(hs0), nat1)), cfv(cedg, c0)), wceq(cfv(cv(hs0), nat0), c2)))), wa(wbr(c0, crusgr, c1), wcel(c2, cfv(cvtx, c0))))
  fveq2d(chash, co(c2, cfv(cclwwlknon, c0), nat2), crab(hs0, cword(cfv(cvtx, c0)), w3a(wceq(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), nat2), wcel(cpr(cfv(cv(hs0), nat0), cfv(cv(hs0), nat1)), cfv(cedg, c0)), wceq(cfv(cv(hs0), nat0), c2))), wa(wbr(c0, crusgr, c1), wcel(c2, cfv(cvtx, c0))))
  a1i(wa(wbr(c0, crusgr, c1), wcel(c2, cfv(cvtx, c0))), wceq(co(c2, cfv(cclwwlknon, c0), nat2), crab(hs0, cword(cfv(cvtx, c0)), w3a(wceq(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), nat2), wcel(cpr(cfv(cv(hs0), nat0), cfv(cv(hs0), nat1)), cfv(cedg, c0)), wceq(cfv(cv(hs0), nat0), c2)))))
  clwwlknon2x(hs0, c2, cfv(cclwwlknon, c0), cfv(cvtx, c0), cfv(cedg, c0), c0)
  eqid(cfv(cclwwlknon, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cedg, c0))
  syl5eqr(cfv(chash, crab(hs0, cword(cfv(cvtx, c0)), w3a(wceq(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), nat2), wcel(cpr(cfv(cv(hs0), nat0), cfv(cv(hs0), nat1)), cfv(cedg, c0)), wceq(cfv(cv(hs0), nat0), c2)))), c1, cfv(chash, crab(hs0, cword(cfv(cvtx, c0)), w3a(wceq(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), nat2), wceq(cfv(cv(hs0), nat0), c2), wcel(cpr(cfv(cv(hs0), nat0), cfv(cv(hs0), nat1)), cfv(cedg, c0))))), wa(wbr(c0, crusgr, c1), wcel(c2, cfv(cvtx, c0))))
  fveq2i(chash, crab(hs0, cword(cfv(cvtx, c0)), w3a(wceq(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), nat2), wceq(cfv(cv(hs0), nat0), c2), wcel(cpr(cfv(cv(hs0), nat0), cfv(cv(hs0), nat1)), cfv(cedg, c0)))), crab(hs0, cword(cfv(cvtx, c0)), w3a(wceq(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), nat2), wcel(cpr(cfv(cv(hs0), nat0), cfv(cv(hs0), nat1)), cfv(cedg, c0)), wceq(cfv(cv(hs0), nat0), c2))))
  rabbii(hs0, cword(cfv(cvtx, c0)), w3a(wceq(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), nat2), wceq(cfv(cv(hs0), nat0), c2), wcel(cpr(cfv(cv(hs0), nat0), cfv(cv(hs0), nat1)), cfv(cedg, c0))), w3a(wceq(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), nat2), wcel(cpr(cfv(cv(hs0), nat0), cfv(cv(hs0), nat1)), cfv(cedg, c0)), wceq(cfv(cv(hs0), nat0), c2)))
  3ancomb(wceq(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), nat2), wceq(cfv(cv(hs0), nat0), c2), wcel(cpr(cfv(cv(hs0), nat0), cfv(cv(hs0), nat1)), cfv(cedg, c0)))
  rusgrnumwrdl2(hs0, c0, c1, c2, cfv(cvtx, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cvtx, c0))
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(cvtx, c0))
}

thm clwwlknon2num(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0[RegUSGraph]c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà(Vtx ` c0))‚Üí(# `(c2[(ClWWalksNOn ` c0)]2))= c1)
} = {

  fveq2d(chash, (c2[(ClWWalksNOn ` c0)]2), { hs0 ‚àà Word((Vtx ` c0))|((# ` hs0)= 2 ‚àß {(hs0 ` 0),(hs0 ` 1)} ‚àà(Edg ` c0)‚àß(hs0 ` 0)= c2)}, (c0[RegUSGraph]c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà(Vtx ` c0)))
  a1i((c0[RegUSGraph]c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà(Vtx ` c0)), (c2[(ClWWalksNOn ` c0)]2)= { hs0 ‚àà Word((Vtx ` c0))|((# ` hs0)= 2 ‚àß {(hs0 ` 0),(hs0 ` 1)} ‚àà(Edg ` c0)‚àß(hs0 ` 0)= c2)})
  clwwlknon2x(hs0, c2, (ClWWalksNOn ` c0), (Vtx ` c0), (Edg ` c0), c0)
  eqid((ClWWalksNOn ` c0))
  eqid((Edg ` c0))
  syl5eqr((# ` { hs0 ‚àà Word((Vtx ` c0))|((# ` hs0)= 2 ‚àß {(hs0 ` 0),(hs0 ` 1)} ‚àà(Edg ` c0)‚àß(hs0 ` 0)= c2)}), c1, (# ` { hs0 ‚àà Word((Vtx ` c0))|((# ` hs0)= 2 ‚àß(hs0 ` 0)= c2 ‚àß {(hs0 ` 0),(hs0 ` 1)} ‚àà(Edg ` c0))}), (c0[RegUSGraph]c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà(Vtx ` c0)))
  fveq2i(chash, { hs0 ‚àà Word((Vtx ` c0))|((# ` hs0)= 2 ‚àß(hs0 ` 0)= c2 ‚àß {(hs0 ` 0),(hs0 ` 1)} ‚àà(Edg ` c0))}, { hs0 ‚àà Word((Vtx ` c0))|((# ` hs0)= 2 ‚àß {(hs0 ` 0),(hs0 ` 1)} ‚àà(Edg ` c0)‚àß(hs0 ` 0)= c2)})
  rabbii(hs0, Word((Vtx ` c0)), ((# ` hs0)= 2 ‚àß(hs0 ` 0)= c2 ‚àß {(hs0 ` 0),(hs0 ` 1)} ‚àà(Edg ` c0)), ((# ` hs0)= 2 ‚àß {(hs0 ` 0),(hs0 ` 1)} ‚àà(Edg ` c0)‚àß(hs0 ` 0)= c2))
  3ancomb((# ` hs0)= 2, (hs0 ` 0)= c2, {(hs0 ` 0),(hs0 ` 1)} ‚àà(Edg ` c0))
  rusgrnumwrdl2(hs0, c0, c1, c2, (Vtx ` c0))
  eqid((Vtx ` c0))
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c((Vtx ` c0))
}

blocks.name: clwwlknonwwlknonb
blocks.content: A word over vertices represents a closed walk of a fixed length ` N ` on vertex ` X ` iff the word concatenated with ` X ` represents a walk of length ` N ` on ` X ` and ` X ` . This theorem would not hold for ` N = 0 ` and ` W = (/) ` , see ~ clwwlknwwlksnb . (Contributed by AV, 4-Mar-2022.) (Revised by AV, 27-Mar-2022.)
blocks.origin:

  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cvtx, c4))
} = {
  3bitr4rd(wa(wcel(c0, cword(c1)), wcel(c2, cn)), wcel(c0, co(c3, cfv(cclwwlknon, c4), c2)), wcel(co(c0, cconcat, cs1(c3)), co(c3, co(c2, cwwlksnon, c4), c3)), w3a(wcel(co(c0, cconcat, cs1(c3)), co(c2, cwwlksn, c4)), wceq(cfv(co(c0, cconcat, cs1(c3)), nat0), c3), wceq(cfv(co(c0, cconcat, cs1(c3)), c2), c3)), wa(wcel(c0, co(c2, cclwwlkn, c4)), wceq(cfv(c0, nat0), c3)))

blocks.name: clwwlknonex2lem1
blocks.content: Lemma 1 for ~ clwwlknonex2 : Transformation of a special half-open integer range into a union of a smaller half-open integer range and an unordered pair. This Lemma would not hold for ` N = 2 ` , i.e., ` ( # `` W ) = 0 ` , because ` ( 0 ..^ ( ( ( # `` W ) + 2 ) - 1 ) ) ` ` = ( 0 ..^ ( ( 0 + 2 ) - 1 ) ) = ( 0 ..^ 1 ) = { 0 } ` ` =/= { -u 1 , 0 } = ( (/) u. { -u 1 , 0 } ) ` ` = ( ( 0 ..^ ( 0 - 1 ) ) u. { ( 0 - 1 ) , 0 } ) ` ` = ( ( 0 ..^ ( ( # `` W ) - 1 ) ) ` ` u. { ( ( # `` W ) - 1 ) , ( # `` W ) } ) ` . (Contributed by AV, 22-Sep-2018.) (Revised by AV, 26-Jan-2022.)

blocks.content: Extending a closed walk ` W ` on vertex ` X ` by an additional edge (forth and back) results in a closed walk. (Contributed by AV, 22-Sep-2018.) (Revised by AV, 25-Feb-2022.) (Proof shortened by AV, 28-Mar-2022.)

blocks.name: clwwlknun
blocks.content: The set of closed walks of fixed length ` N ` in a simple graph ` G ` is the union of the closed walks of the fixed length ` N ` on each of the vertices of graph ` G ` . (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 7-Oct-2018.) (Revised by AV, 28-May-2021.) (Revised by AV, 3-Mar-2022.) (Proof shortened by AV, 28-Mar-2022.)

blocks.name: clwwlkvbij
blocks.content: There is a bijection between the set of closed walks of a fixed length ` N ` on a fixed vertex ` X ` represented by walks (as word) and the set of closed walks (as words) of the fixed length ` N ` on the fixed vertex ` X ` . The difference between these two representations is that in the first case the fixed vertex is repeated at the end of the word, and in the second case it is not. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 29-Sep-2018.) (Revised by AV, 26-Apr-2021.) (Revised by AV, 7-Jul-2022.) (Proof shortened by AV, 2-Nov-2022.)
blocks.origin:
